apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the large red circle emoji is a perfectly rendered sphere, appearing with a vibrant, almost luminous crimson. Its surface boasts Apple's signature glossy 3D shading, creating a soft, rounded edge and subtle highlights that suggest a polished, tactile quality. This emoji is often used to draw attention, indicate a warning, or simply as a bold, impactful visual element in digital communication.

components.description: A circle shown in the color of red. May be used to represent anything red.
components.title: Large Red Circle

description: A circle shown in the color of red. May be used to represent anything red.
title: Large Red Circle

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Geometric shapes
emoji_net_data.definition: Red Circle was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Large Red Circle” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015. Copy and paste this http://emojipedia.org/large-red-circle/
emoji_net_data.name: red circle

bn:00103545a: Of or relating to or determined by geometry
Of, or relating to geometry; geometric.

bn:00098581a: Of a color at the end of the color spectrum (next to orange); resembling the color of blood or cherries or tomatoes or rubies
Bright red in color, like the color of fresh blood.
Of the purplish red colour shade carmine.

bn:00088456v: Move with force, "He pushed the table into a corner"
To apply a force to (an object) such that it moves away from the person or thing applying the force.
Transitive: apply a force to (an object) so that it moves away.

bn:13761150v: To show or contain an error or fault.

bn:13761149v: To function improperly due to an error, especially accompanied by error message.
To cause or contain an error.

bn:00031485n: A programming error that can cause the software to fail.
A wrong action attributable to bad judgment or ignorance or inattention.
An incorrect action not made deliberately.
Mistakes are avoidable occurances wherein a person unintentionally does something that causes an unfortunate result.
The word error entails different meanings and usages relative to how it is conceptually applied.
A mistake; an accidental wrong action or a false statement not made deliberately.
A wrong action attributable to bad judgment or ignorance or inattention

bn:00066631n: One of the three primary additive colors
The quality of being red in color.
Red is the color at the end of the visible spectrum next to orange and at the opposite end from violet.

Any of a range of colours having the longest wavelengths, 670 nm, of the visible spectrum; a primary additive colour for transmitted light: the colour obtained by subtracting green and blue from white light using magenta and yellow filters; the colour of blood, ripe strawberries, etc.
The blood-red colour of raw flesh.
Red color or pigment; the chromatic color resembling the hue of blood

The colour obtained by subtracting green and blue from white. A primary colour in the additive colour system, and a secondary colour in the subtractive colour system. It is the complementary colour of cyan.

bn:00025170n: An instance or cause of liable harm.
Instance or cause of liable harm.
The condition of being susceptible to harm or injury

bn:00019169n: A two-dimensional geometric figure, a disk, consisting of the set of all those points of a plane at a distance less than or equal to a fixed distance from another point.
Ellipse in which the two axes are of equal length; a plane curve generated by one point moving at a constant distance from a fixed point
A circle is a simple shape of Euclidean geometry that is the set of all points in a plane that are at a given distance from a given point, the center.
Circles are simple shapes of Euclidean geometry consisting of those points in a plane which are equidistant from a given point, the center.
A two-dimensional, geometric shape that is made up of every point on a plane which is equidistant from the centre. May be drawn with a pair of compasses.
